CHARLEVOIX COUNTY PROBATE & FAMILY COURT
301 STATE ST,
CHARLEVOIX, MI, 49720-1396
Re: License #: CA150201032
Dear Mr. Smith:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/11/24. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency has ensured that the foster care and licensing program has
maintained compliance with Act 116, Administrative Licensing Rules by reviewing
applicable policy and implementing all licensing requirements set forth by DCWL.
There have not been any barriers that have impacted their ability to be in
compliance with DCWL requirements.
Financial Overview
A copy of the County Child Care Budget was submitted and reviewed. No
concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The Chief Administrator was interviewed. The Chief Administrator reported that
the agency is working on recruitment of foster homes. The one other Court
employee for this program was not available for an interview.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The Courts programing is located in a local school building. The facility is well
maintained and organized. CHRI documentation was stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is non contracted, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
December 16, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
